title: Drawing, "Design for a Chinese Pavilion", 1815–22
medium: Brush and watercolor, pen and ink on paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description:
Vertical rectangle. An octagonal structure standing on a podium, columns supporting the two-tiered pagoda roof. A narrow porch surrounds the enclosed inner cove of the building. A short flight of steps leads to the entrance of the pavilion.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Chinese Pavilion", 1815–22.
1815–22. Brush and watercolor, pen and ink on paper. Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 1948-40-82.
